title: Code of Conduct
text: project follows Contributor Covenant Code Conduct. https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct/ Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported maintainers temuulen@gmail.com.

title: Contributing to mongolstats
text: Thanks interest contributing! project welcomes issues, ideas, pull requests.

title: Contributing to mongolstats
text: Requires R (>= 4.1). Recommended: RStudio vignette building (bundles Pandoc). Install dependencies go; smoke/test scripts handle .

title: Contributing to mongolstats
text: Rscript tools/smoke.R Rscript -e "invisible(lapply(list.files('R', full.names=TRUE), source)); library(testthat); test_dir('tests/testthat', reporter='summary')" Rscript tools/build_site.R

title: Contributing to mongolstats
text: Keep changes focused tidyverse-styled. Add tests new behavior feasible. Update README vignettes user-facing behavior changes.

title: Contributing to mongolstats
text: participating, agree abide Code Conduct CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md.

title: Batch fetching workflows
code: reqs <- list(   list(tbl_id = "DT_NSO_0300_001V2", selections = list(Sex = "Total", Age = "Total", Year = "2024")),   list(tbl_id = "DT_NSO_0300_004V5", selections = list(Year = "2024")) ) reqs ## [[1]] ## [[1]]$tbl_id ## [1] "DT_NSO_0300_001V2" ##  ## [[1]]$selections ## [[1]]$selections$Sex ## [1] "Total" ##  ## [[1]]$selections$Age ## [1] "Total" ##  ## [[1]]$selections$Year ## [1] "2024" ##  ##  ##  ## [[2]] ## [[2]]$tbl_id ## [1] "DT_NSO_0300_004V5" ##  ## [[2]]$selections ## [[2]]$selections$Year ## [1] "2024"

title: Batch fetching workflows
code: pkg <- nso_package(reqs, labels = "en") pkg %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) ## # A tibble: 10 × 12 ##    Sex   Age   Year    value tbl_id        Sex_en Age_en Year_en Region Location ##    <chr> <chr> <chr>   <dbl> <chr>         <chr>  <chr>  <chr>   <chr>  <chr>    ##  1 0     0     0     3441598 DT_NSO_0300_… Total  Total  2024    NA     NA       ##  2 NA    NA    0     3441598 DT_NSO_0300_… NA     NA     2024    0      0        ##  3 NA    NA    0     2420582 DT_NSO_0300_… NA     NA     2024    0      1        ##  4 NA    NA    0     1021016 DT_NSO_0300_… NA     NA     2024    0      2        ##  5 NA    NA    0      415576 DT_NSO_0300_… NA     NA     2024    1      0        ##  6 NA    NA    0      145420 DT_NSO_0300_… NA     NA     2024    1      1        ##  7 NA    NA    0      270156 DT_NSO_0300_… NA     NA     2024    1      2        ##  8 NA    NA    0      110799 DT_NSO_0300_… NA     NA     2024    183    0        ##  9 NA    NA    0       43749 DT_NSO_0300_… NA     NA     2024    183    1        ## 10 NA    NA    0       67050 DT_NSO_0300_… NA     NA     2024    183    2        ## # ℹ 2 more variables: Region_en <chr>, Location_en <chr>

title: Batch fetching workflows
text: batch includes different tables, nso_package() adds tbl_id column, enabling grouped summaries:
code: pkg %>%   dplyr::group_by(tbl_id) %>%   dplyr::summarise(total = sum(value, na.rm = TRUE), n = dplyr::n()) ## # A tibble: 2 × 3 ##   tbl_id               total     n ##   <chr>                <dbl> <int> ## 1 DT_NSO_0300_001V2  3441598     1 ## 2 DT_NSO_0300_004V5 34415980  6660

title: Batch fetching workflows
text: can also provide tibble tbl_id selections list-column: Tips large batches, enable caching discovery-heavy steps: nso_cache_enable(). Handle intermittent network failures re-running affected tables; nso_package() processes request independently. ## Combine discovery utilities
code: req_tbl <- tibble::tibble(   tbl_id = c("DT_NSO_0300_001V2","DT_NSO_0300_004V5"),   selections = list(     list(Sex = "Total", Age = "Total", Year = c("2023","2024")),     list(Year = c("2023","2024"))   ) )  pkg2 <- nso_package(req_tbl, labels = "en") pkg2 %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) ## # A tibble: 10 × 12 ##    Sex   Age   Year    value tbl_id        Sex_en Age_en Year_en Region Location ##    <chr> <chr> <chr>   <dbl> <chr>         <chr>  <chr>  <chr>   <chr>  <chr>    ##  1 0     0     0     3441598 DT_NSO_0300_… Total  Total  2024    NA     NA       ##  2 0     0     1     3396788 DT_NSO_0300_… Total  Total  2023    NA     NA       ##  3 NA    NA    0     3441598 DT_NSO_0300_… NA     NA     2024    0      0        ##  4 NA    NA    1     3396788 DT_NSO_0300_… NA     NA     2023    0      0        ##  5 NA    NA    0     2420582 DT_NSO_0300_… NA     NA     2024    0      1        ##  6 NA    NA    1     2374571 DT_NSO_0300_… NA     NA     2023    0      1        ##  7 NA    NA    0     1021016 DT_NSO_0300_… NA     NA     2024    0      2        ##  8 NA    NA    1     1022217 DT_NSO_0300_… NA     NA     2023    0      2        ##  9 NA    NA    0      415576 DT_NSO_0300_… NA     NA     2024    1      0        ## 10 NA    NA    1      413704 DT_NSO_0300_… NA     NA     2023    1      0        ## # ℹ 2 more variables: Region_en <chr>, Location_en <chr> itms <- nso_tables() target <- itms %>% dplyr::filter(stringr::str_detect(stringr::str_to_lower(tbl_eng_nm), "population")) %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 5) target %>% dplyr::select(tbl_id, tbl_eng_nm) ## # A tibble: 5 × 2 ##   tbl_id             tbl_eng_nm                                                  ##   <chr>              <chr>                                                       ## 1 DT_NSO_2100_012V1  NEW CASES OF CANCER, per 10000 population, by type of canc… ## 2 DT_NSO_2100_013V1  DEATHS OF CANCER, per 10000 population, by type of cancer   ## 3 DT_NSO_2100_045V1  NEW CASES AND MORTALITY OF CANCER PER 10 000 POPULATION, b… ## 4 DT_NSO_0300_071V02 INPATIENTS PER 10000 POPULATION, 10 leading classification… ## 5 DT_NSO_0100_01T39  NUMBER OF WORKING AGED POPULATION, by year

title: Code-based joins with mongolstats
text: Prefer ISO-like stable keys (e.g., shapeISO) names available. Keep crosswalks version control (e.g., inst/extdata/…) document provenance. Validate joins checking unmatched rows duplicates key.

title: Discovering tables and variables
text: PXWeb exposes tree folders (sectors/subsectors) containing tables. Discovery functions help : Navigate catalog nso_sectors() nso_subsectors() List available tables nso_itms() Search keyword nso_itms_search() / nso_search() Explore table’s variables using nso_variables()

title: Discovering tables and variables
code: itms <- nso_itms() itms %>% dplyr::select(tbl_id, tbl_eng_nm, strt_prd, end_prd) %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) ## # A tibble: 10 × 4 ##    tbl_id             tbl_eng_nm                                strt_prd end_prd ##    <chr>              <chr>                                     <chr>    <chr>   ##  1 DT_NSO_0100_001V10 BALANCE OF PAYMENTS, by month             NA       NA      ##  2 DT_NSO_0300_010V5  WEEKLY PRICES OF MAIN PRODUCTS AND GASOL… 2025-09… 2024-0… ##  3 DT_NSO_0303_07V7   CONSUMER PRICE INDEX IN AIMAGS, compared… 2015=100 2023=1… ##  4 DT_NSO_0303_07V8   CONSUMER PRICE INDEX IN AIMAGS, compared… 2015=100 2023=1… ##  5 DT_NSO_0303_07V9   CONSUMER PRICE INDEX IN AIMAGS, compared… 2015=100 2023=1… ##  6 DT_NSO_0600_001V3  NATIONAL BASE CONSUMER PRICE INDEX, by g… 2015=100 2023=1… ##  7 DT_NSO_0600_001V4  WEEKLY PRICES OF MAIN PRODUCTS AND GASOL… 2025-09… 2021-0… ##  8 DT_NSO_0600_002V1  NATIONAL CONSUMER PRICE INDEX, 1991-1-16… 2024     1991    ##  9 DT_NSO_0600_002V21 CONSUMER PRICE INDEX, by group, compared… 2015=100 2023=1… ## 10 DT_NSO_0600_002V22 CONSUMER PRICE INDEX, by group, compared… 2015=100 2023=1…

title: Discovering tables and variables
text: Top-level categories (folder-like nodes): Children category (pass id ):
code: root <- nso_sectors() root %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) ## # A tibble: 8 × 3 ##   id                    type  text                  ##   <chr>                 <chr> <chr>                 ## 1 Economy, environment  l     Economy, environment  ## 2 Education, health     l     Education, health     ## 3 Historical data       l     Historical data       ## 4 Industry, service     l     Industry, service     ## 5 Labour, business      l     Labour, business      ## 6 Population, household l     Population, household ## 7 Regional development  l     Regional development  ## 8 Society, development  l     Society, development first_id <- if (nrow(root)) root$id[1] else "" kids <- nso_subsectors(first_id) kids %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) ## # A tibble: 10 × 3 ##    id                             type  text                           ##    <chr>                          <chr> <chr>                          ##  1 Balance of Payments            l     Balance of Payments            ##  2 Consumer Price Index           l     Consumer Price Index           ##  3 Environment                    l     Environment                    ##  4 Environmental-Economic Account l     Environmental-Economic Account ##  5 Foreign Trade                  l     Foreign Trade                  ##  6 Government budget              l     Government budget              ##  7 Housing price index            l     Housing price index            ##  8 Investment                     l     Investment                     ##  9 Money and Finance              l     Money and Finance              ## 10 National Accounts              l     National Accounts

title: Discovering tables and variables
code: pop <- nso_itms_search("population") pop %>% dplyr::select(tbl_id, tbl_eng_nm) %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) ## # A tibble: 0 × 2 ## # ℹ 2 variables: tbl_id <chr>, tbl_eng_nm <chr>

title: Discovering tables and variables
text: Tips Use field identify dimension names ’ll pass selections fetching data. field codes (itm_id) English/Mongolian labels (scr_eng/scr_mn).
code: vars <- nso_variables("DT_NSO_0300_001V2") vars %>% dplyr::count(field) ## # A tibble: 3 × 2 ##   field     n ##   <chr> <int> ## 1 Age      88 ## 2 Sex       3 ## 3 Year     25 vars %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) ## # A tibble: 10 × 6 ##    field itm_id scr_eng scr_mn px_path                                   px_file ##    <chr> <chr>  <chr>   <chr>  <chr>                                     <chr>   ##  1 Sex   0      Total   NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  2 Sex   1      Male    NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  3 Sex   2      Female  NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  4 Age   0      Total   NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  5 Age   1      0       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  6 Age   2      1       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  7 Age   3      2       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  8 Age   4      3       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  9 Age   5      4       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ## 10 Age   6      5       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO…

title: Fetching data and working with periods
Fetching data and working with periods

what: Fetch data by period and variables
title: Fetching data and working with periods
code: dat <- nso_data(   tbl_id = "DT_NSO_0300_001V2",   selections = list(Sex = "Total", Age = "Total", Year = head(periods, 1)),   labels = "en" ) dat %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 6) ## # A tibble: 1 × 7 ##   Sex   Age   Year    value Sex_en Age_en Year_en ##   <chr> <chr> <chr>   <dbl> <chr>  <chr>  <chr>   ## 1 0     0     0     3441598 Total  Total  2024

what: Multi-year pulls and quick trend summaries
title: Fetching data and working with periods
text: prefer quick base plot interactive work:
code: yrs <- head(periods, 5) series <- nso_data(   tbl_id = tbl,   selections = list(Sex = "Total", Age = "Total", Year = yrs) )  series %>%   dplyr::group_by(Year) %>%   dplyr::summarise(value = sum(value, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%   dplyr::arrange(Year) ## # A tibble: 5 × 2 ##   Year    value ##   <chr>   <dbl> ## 1 0     3441598 ## 2 1     3396788 ## 3 2     3368632 ## 4 3     3312275 ## 5 4     3253283 trend <- series %>% dplyr::group_by(Year) %>% dplyr::summarise(value = sum(value, na.rm = TRUE)) if (nrow(trend) > 1) plot(as.numeric(trend$Year), trend$value, type = "b", main = "Total by Year", xlab = "Year", ylab = "Value")

title: Fuzzy name joins with mongolstats
text: Use max_distance conservatively (e.g., 1–2) avoid incorrect matches. can supply different string distance method stringdist installed; Jaro-Winkler Levenshtein common choices. Always review near ties ambiguous matches manually; consider exporting candidate pairs QA dataset critical.

title: Getting started with mongolstats
text: vignette introduces core workflow using mongolstats: Discover tables explore variables (codebooks) Fetch data selecting values table dimension Optionally enrich English/Mongolian labels readability Work period utilities time series ’ll keep examples small clarity; see vignettes discovery, periods, mapping, batch workflows.

title: Getting started with mongolstats
code: itms <- nso_itms() itms %>% dplyr::select(dplyr::any_of(c("tbl_id", "tbl_eng_nm", "strt_prd", "end_prd"))) %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 5) ## # A tibble: 5 × 4 ##   tbl_id             tbl_eng_nm                                 strt_prd end_prd ##   <chr>              <chr>                                      <chr>    <chr>   ## 1 DT_NSO_0100_001V10 BALANCE OF PAYMENTS, by month              NA       NA      ## 2 DT_NSO_0300_010V5  WEEKLY PRICES OF MAIN PRODUCTS AND GASOLI… 2025-09… 2024-0… ## 3 DT_NSO_0303_07V7   CONSUMER PRICE INDEX IN AIMAGS, compared … 2015=100 2023=1… ## 4 DT_NSO_0303_07V8   CONSUMER PRICE INDEX IN AIMAGS, compared … 2015=100 2023=1… ## 5 DT_NSO_0303_07V9   CONSUMER PRICE INDEX IN AIMAGS, compared … 2015=100 2023=1…

title: Getting started with mongolstats
text: Notes PXWeb table one dimensions (e.g., Year, Sex, Age). Use labels select values. can pass values codes labels; mongolstats maps labels codes hood .
code: vars <- nso_variables("DT_NSO_0300_001V2") vars %>% dplyr::count(field) ## # A tibble: 3 × 2 ##   field     n ##   <chr> <int> ## 1 Age      88 ## 2 Sex       3 ## 3 Year     25 vars %>% dplyr::filter(field %in% c("Sex","Age","Year")) %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) ## # A tibble: 10 × 6 ##    field itm_id scr_eng scr_mn px_path                                   px_file ##    <chr> <chr>  <chr>   <chr>  <chr>                                     <chr>   ##  1 Sex   0      Total   NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  2 Sex   1      Male    NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  3 Sex   2      Female  NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  4 Age   0      Total   NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  5 Age   1      0       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  6 Age   2      1       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  7 Age   3      2       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  8 Age   4      3       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ##  9 Age   5      4       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO… ## 10 Age   6      5       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous… DT_NSO…

title: Getting started with mongolstats
code: per <- tryCatch(tail(nso_table_periods("DT_NSO_0300_001V2"), 1), error = function(e) "") yr <- if (length(per) && nzchar(per[1])) per else "2022" dat <- nso_data(   tbl_id = "DT_NSO_0300_001V2",   selections = list(Sex = "Total", Age = "Total", Year = yr) )  dat %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 6) ## # A tibble: 1 × 4 ##   Sex   Age   Year    value ##   <chr> <chr> <chr>   <dbl> ## 1 0     0     24    2374617

title: Getting started with mongolstats
text: can also select using dimension codes. table, Sex codes 0 (Total), 1 (Male), 2 (Female). following equivalent:
code: yr <- tryCatch(tail(nso_table_periods("DT_NSO_0300_001V2"), 1), error = function(e) "2022") dat_lbl <- nso_data(   tbl_id = "DT_NSO_0300_001V2",   selections = list(Sex = "Total", Age = "Total", Year = yr) )  dat_code <- nso_data(   tbl_id = "DT_NSO_0300_001V2",   selections = list(Sex = "0", Age = "0", Year = yr) )  list(rows_label = nrow(dat_lbl), rows_code = nrow(dat_code)) ## $rows_label ## [1] 1 ##  ## $rows_code ## [1] 1

title: Getting started with mongolstats
text: Use labels argument add readable columns dimension:
code: per <- tryCatch(nso_table_periods("DT_NSO_0300_001V2"), error = function(e) character()) yrs <- if (length(per) >= 2) tail(per, 2) else per if (!length(yrs)) yrs <- c("2021","2022") dat_labeled <- nso_data(   tbl_id = "DT_NSO_0300_001V2",   selections = list(Sex = c("Male","Female"), Age = "Total", Year = yrs),   labels = "en" )  dat_labeled %>% dplyr::select(dplyr::any_of(c("Year","Sex","value","Year_en","Sex_en"))) %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 8) ## # A tibble: 4 × 5 ##   Year  Sex     value Year_en Sex_en ##   <chr> <chr>   <dbl> <chr>   <chr>  ## 1 23    1     1176858 2001    Male   ## 2 24    1     1166478 2000    Male   ## 3 23    2     1221849 2001    Female ## 4 24    2     1208139 2000    Female

title: Getting started with mongolstats
text: Use helpers discover valid periods table build sequences:

title: Getting started with mongolstats
text: dplyr, ’s straightforward summarise values year category:
code: per <- tryCatch(nso_table_periods("DT_NSO_0300_001V2"), error = function(e) character()) yrs <- if (length(per) >= 5) tail(per, 5) else per if (!length(yrs)) yrs <- c("2018","2019","2020","2021","2022") dat_year <- nso_data(   tbl_id = "DT_NSO_0300_001V2",   selections = list(Sex = "Total", Age = "Total", Year = yrs) )  dat_year %>%   dplyr::group_by(Year) %>%   dplyr::summarise(value = sum(value, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%   dplyr::arrange(Year) %>%   dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) ## # A tibble: 5 × 2 ##   Year    value ##   <chr>   <dbl> ## 1 20    2474438 ## 2 21    2450790 ## 3 22    2425999 ## 4 23    2398707 ## 5 24    2374617

title: Mapping with mongolstats
text: dataset includes stable identifiers, prefer key-based joins mn_boundary_keys():
code: keys <- mn_boundary_keys("ADM1")  # contains shapeID, shapeName, shapeISO, name_std # Example: if your data has shapeISO, join on that instead of names

title: Mapping with mongolstats
text: site accessibility, set alt text captions plot chunks: ADM1 map example

title: Authors and Citation
text: Temuulen Enebish. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Enebish T (2025). Mongolian NSO PXWeb Data Boundaries (Tidy Client). R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://temuulene.github.io/mongolstats/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {Mongolian NSO PXWeb Data and Boundaries (Tidy Client)},   author = {Temuulen Enebish},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://temuulene.github.io/mongolstats/}, }

title: mongolstats
text: Tidy access National Statistics Office Mongolia (NSO) statistics via PXWeb API (data.1212.mn) Mongolia administrative boundaries, inspired ergonomics tidycensus. Provides tidyverse-friendly interface discovering tables, exploring codebooks, fetching data, working sf geometries mapping.

title: mongolstats
code: library(mongolstats) library(dplyr)  # Use new PXWeb API (data.1212.mn) nso_options(mongolstats.lang = "en")  # List available tables itms <- nso_itms() itms %>% select(tbl_id, tbl_eng_nm, strt_prd, end_prd) %>% slice_head(n = 5)  # Inspect variables (codebook) for a table vars <- nso_variables("DT_NSO_0300_001V2") vars %>% count(field)  # Fetch data dat <- nso_data(   tbl_id = "DT_NSO_0300_001V2",   selections = list(Sex = "Total", Age = "Total", Year = "2024") ) dat %>% slice_head(n = 6)

title: mongolstats
text: PXWeb client NSO data (data.1212.mn) Discover tables variables nso_itms() / nso_itms_detail() Fetch data via nso_data(tbl_id, selections=...); batch nso_package() Optional label columns English Mongolian (labels = "en" | "mn" | "") Category navigation table search helpers Mongolia administrative boundaries (ADM0–ADM2) sf Exact fuzzy name-based boundary joins Lightweight -disk caching faster table/codebook lookups

title: Mongolia administrative boundaries (sf) — mn_boundaries

title: Fuzzy join data to boundaries by name — mn_fuzzy_join_by_name
code: mn_fuzzy_join_by_name(   data,   name_col,   level = "ADM1",   boundaries = NULL,   max_distance = 2,   method = c("osa", "lv", "jw", "dl") )

title: Fuzzy join data to boundaries by name — mn_fuzzy_join_by_name
text: data Data frame name column. name_col Column data containing names. level Boundary level. boundaries Optional pre-fetched boundaries. max_distance Maximum string distance match (default 2). method Distance method passed stringdist::stringdist.

title: Fuzzy join data to boundaries by name — mn_fuzzy_join_by_name

title: mongolstats 0.0.0.9000
text: Initial development snapshot. NSO API wrappers: nso_itms(), nso_itms_detail(), nso_data(), nso_package() Sector helpers: nso_sectors(), nso_subsectors(), nso_search() Boundaries: mn_boundaries(), join helpers incl. fuzzy joins Caching discovery endpoints Vignettes getting started, mapping, fuzzy joins, code-based joins
